intro: Centaurea alba subsp. ipecensis, commonly known as the Ipeç Whitehead, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces fluffy, composite flower heads. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
